full_summary:
*Maintenance of National Antimicrobial Drug Use and Resistance Surveillance Program and Sentinel-Site Based Food and Water-Borne Pathogen Surveillance Program*

**Solicitation Title**

* **English**: Canadian Integrated Program for Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance (CIPARS) Poultry Veterinarian Services
* **French**: Services vétérinaires visant les fermes d’élevages la volaille – Programme intégré canadien de surveillance de la résistance aux antimicrobiens (PICRA)

**Solicitation Reference Number**: PW-23-01027978
**Amendment Number**: 1
**Solicitation Number**: 1000248875
**Publication Date**: February 27, 2023
**Tender Closing Date**: December 15, 2023 
**Amendment Date**: May 15, 2023

**Status**
The solicitation is **Expired**.

**Geographic Scope**
This tender is relevant to **Canada**.

**Procurement Method**
The procurement will follow a **Competitive - Open Bidding** process.

**Notice Type**
This notice is for a **Request for Proposal**.

**Trade Agreements**
The procurement will be conducted under various trade agreements, including the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement.

**Contracting Entity**
The contracting entity is **Health Canada**.

**Contact Information**
For further information, please contact:
Johnson, Drew
drew.johnson@canada.ca
613-941-2102

**Attachments**
The following documents are available for download:
* Bidder Response Template (English)
* Bidder Response Template (French)
* NPP Final Report (English)
* NPP Final Report (French)
* Generic Sampling Checklist (English)
* Generic Sampling Checklist (French)
* 2023 Amended NPP Poultry Bidders Template (English)
* 2023 Amended NPP Poultry Bidders Template (French)

**Summary**
The Public Health Agency of Canada has issued a solicitation for a vendor to provide poultry veterinarian services in support of the Canadian Integrated Program for Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance (CIPARS) and a sentinel-site based food and water-borne pathogen surveillance program under FoodNet Canada. The vendor will be responsible for collecting data on antimicrobial use and resistance in poultry, as well as supporting the development of epidemiology reports. The selected vendor will be required to provide qualified poultry veterinarians to conduct farm visits, collect
